page.title: 13Hatfield Broad Oak Farms: 2
page.content: {Information derived from an interview { with a local farmer - continued. { }Britain's membership of the European Economic Community has had some effect on the type of crops grown; for instance, local farms are now growing some French varieties of wheat. Also, the past few years have seen notable increases in the yields: an area which a few years ago was producing 1.5 to 2 tons per acre will now be yielding 3 to 4 tons. Farmers depend on the EEC for their markets and much locally grown corn is now sold abroad. Carefully controlled stubble burning is carried out to help to prepare the land for the following season's crop. Other recent changes in farming methods have meant the loss of some hedgerows and the reduction in height of others to make possible the efficient use of machinery.
